intro: Mulgedium prenanthoides, commonly known as the slender mulgedium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of eastern North America, particularly in moist woodland habitats. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. It typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 feet and prefers partial to full shade. Mulgedium prenanthoides is often found in rich, loamy soils and is a valuable component of native plant communities.
